page.title: 07HIGHEAD CHAPEL
page.content:
The Chapel was built in 1358 to save the Keeper of the Castle and Forest and his staff the trip to Dalston. The Chapel of Ease operated out of Dalston and was never an independent parish. The Chapel was awkwardly placed for use by a wider population which gave rise to the construction of Christ Church, Ivegill, and to the formation of an independent Parish.
The building was declared redundant in 1972 and fell into disrepair. It is currently used as a hay store and occasionally for wintering of cattle.
The consecrated fittings were either destroyed by order of the then Archdeacon, or, by public concern, removed to places of safety.
